text.0: thee verily o thunderwielding indra all the gods here the helpers swift to listen.
text.1: and both the worlds elected thee the mighty high waxen strong alone to slaughter vṛtra.
text.2: the gods as worn witheld relaxed their efforts thou indra born of truth wast sovran ruler.
text.3: thou slewest ahi who besieged the waters and duggest out their allsupporting channels.
text.4: the insatiate one extended hard to waken who slumbered in perpetual sleep o indra.
text.5: the dragon stretched against the seven prone rivers where no joint was thou rentest with thy thunder.
text.6: indra with might shook earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the water with its fury.
text.7: striving with strength he burst the firm asunder and tore away the summits of the mountains.
text.8: they ran to thee as mothers to their offspring the clouds like chariots hastened forth together.
text.9: thou didst refresh the streams and force the billows thou indra settest free obstructed rivers.
text.10: thou for the sake of vayya and turvīti didst stay the great stream flowing allsustaining.
text.11: yea at their prayer didst check the rushing river and make the floods easy to cross o indra.
text.12: he let the young maids skilled in law unwedded like fountains bubbling flow forth streaming onward.
text.13: he inundated thirsty plains and deserts and milked the dry cows of the mighty master.
text.14: through many a morn and many a lovely autumn having slain vṛtra he set free the rivers.
text.15: indra hath set at liberty to wander on earth the streams encompassed pressed together.
text.16: lord of bay steeds thou broughtest from the anthill the unwedded damsels son whom ants were eating.
text.17: the blind saw clearly as he grasped the serpent rose brake the jar his joints again united.
text.18: to the wise man o sage and sovran ruler the man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits.
text.19: hath told these deeds of might as thou hast wrought them great acts spontaneous and to mans advantage.
text.20: now indra lauded glorified with praises let powers swell high like rivers for the singer.
text.21: for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we carborne through song be victors ever.
